cscd211Game.Players

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • cscd211Game.Players.Player

  • public class Player
extends java.lang.Object
    The player class represents a typical card player. The player contains for its private data members a count of the cards in the players hand, the players name and an array of type Card that holds the individual cards the player has

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int count
      Representing the data member for the count of the cards in the players hand
      private Card[] hand
      Representing the data member for the array of Cards the player is holding
      private java.lang.String name
      Representing the data member for the player's name which is a single string

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Player(java.lang.String name, int totalCards)
      The EVC creates a player based on the players name and how many cards the player will have in their hand

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Card getCard(int cardNum)
      The getCard method returns a specific card from the player's hand
      int getHandTotal()
      The getHandTotal calculates the total score of the cards in the players hand.
      java.lang.String getName()
      The getName method returns the players name
      int getTotalCards()
      The getTotalCards method returns the total number of cards in the player's hand
      void giveCard(Card card)
      The giveCard method places a card into the player's hand
      void resetPlayerHand()
      The resetPlayerHand resets the number of cards in the players hand This method gets called at the end of each round of play

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Player

        public Player(java.lang.String name,
              int totalCards)
        The EVC creates a player based on the players name and how many cards the player will have in their hand
        Parameters:
        name - Representing the player's name
        totalCards - Representing the totalCards the player can hold
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the name is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the name is empty or totalCards is less than 1

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        The getName method returns the players name
        Returns:
        String - Representing the player's name

      • giveCard

        public void giveCard(Card card)
        The giveCard method places a card into the player's hand
        Parameters:
        card - Representing the dealt card that is placed in the player's hand
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if card is null

      • getCard

        public Card getCard(int cardNum)
        The getCard method returns a specific card from the player's hand
        Parameters:
        cardNum - Representing the card in the player's hand to return
        Returns:
        Card - Representing the specific card in the player's hand
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if cardNum is less than 0 or if cardNum is greater than the length of the player's hand minus 1

      • getHandTotal

        public int getHandTotal()
        The getHandTotal calculates the total score of the cards in the players hand. The hand contains individual cards. You will need to grab the value enumerated type and then grab the specific values rank
        Returns:
        int - Representing the total score of the player's hand

      • getTotalCards

        public int getTotalCards()
        The getTotalCards method returns the total number of cards in the player's hand
        Returns:
        int - Representing the total cards in the player's hand

      • resetPlayerHand

        public void resetPlayerHand()
        The resetPlayerHand resets the number of cards in the players hand This method gets called at the end of each round of play
